intro: Viguiera canescens, commonly known as the grayleaf coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features silver-gray foliage that helps it conserve water in arid environments. It produces daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Viguiera canescens is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
